segment.source: Planning for Custom Template Deployment for UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Planning for Custom Template Deployment for UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Planning for Custom Template Deployment for UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Planning for Custom Template Deployment for UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Planning for Custom Template Deployment for UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Planning for Custom Template Deployment for UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) uses settings location templates (XML files) that define the settings that are captured and applied by UE-V.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) uses settings location templates (XML files) that define the settings that are captured and applied by UE-V.

segment.source: You can use the UE-V Generator to create custom settings location templates that let users roam the settings of applications other than those that are included in the default UE-V templates.
segment.target: You can use the UE-V Generator to create custom settings location templates that let users roam the settings of applications other than those that are included in the default UE-V templates.

segment.source: After you test the custom template to ensure that the application settings roam correctly in a test environment, you can deploy these settings location templates to computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: After you test the custom template to ensure that the application settings roam correctly in a test environment, you can deploy these settings location templates to computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: You can deploy your custom settings location templates with an existing deployment infrastructure, such as Enterprise Software Distribution (ESD), with Group Policy preferences, or by configuring a UE-V settings template catalog.
segment.target: You can deploy your custom settings location templates with an existing deployment infrastructure, such as Enterprise Software Distribution (ESD), with Group Policy preferences, or by configuring a UE-V settings template catalog.

segment.source: Templates that are deployed by using ESD or Group Policy must be registered with UE-V WMI or PowerShell.
segment.target: Templates that are deployed by using ESD or Group Policy must be registered with UE-V WMI or PowerShell.

segment.source: Settings template catalog
segment.target: Settings template catalog

segment.source: The User Experience Virtualization settings template catalog is a folder path on UE-V computers or a Server Message Block (SMB) network share that stores all the custom settings location templates.
segment.target: The User Experience Virtualization settings template catalog is a folder path on UE-V computers or a Server Message Block (SMB) network share that stores all the custom settings location templates.

segment.source: The UE-V agent retrieves new or updated templates from this location.
segment.target: The UE-V agent retrieves new or updated templates from this location.

segment.source: The UE-V agent checks this location once each day and updates its synchronization behavior based on the templates in this folder.
segment.target: The UE-V agent checks this location once each day and updates its synchronization behavior based on the templates in this folder.

segment.source: Templates that were added or updated in this folder since the last time that the folder was checked are registered by the UE-V agent.
segment.target: Templates that were added or updated in this folder since the last time that the folder was checked are registered by the UE-V agent.

segment.source: The UE-V agent deregisters templates that are removed from this folder.
segment.target: The UE-V agent deregisters templates that are removed from this folder.

segment.source: By default, templates are registered and unregistered one time per day at 3:30 A.M.
segment.target: By default, templates are registered and unregistered one time per day at 3:30 A.M.

segment.source: local time by the task scheduler.
segment.target: local time by the task scheduler.

segment.source: For more information about the UE-V tasks, see Changing the Frequency of UE-V Scheduled Tasks.
segment.target: For more information about the UE-V tasks, see Changing the Frequency of UE-V Scheduled Tasks.

segment.source: You can configure the settings template catalog path by using the install command-line options, Group Policy, WMI, or PowerShell.
segment.target: You can configure the settings template catalog path by using the install command-line options, Group Policy, WMI, or PowerShell.

segment.source: Templates that are stored at the settings template catalog path are automatically registered and unregistered by a scheduled task.
segment.target: Templates that are stored at the settings template catalog path are automatically registered and unregistered by a scheduled task.

segment.source: You can customize this scheduled task as needed.
segment.target: You can customize this scheduled task as needed.

segment.source: Replace the default Microsoft templates
segment.target: Replace the default Microsoft templates

segment.source: The UE-V agent installs a default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications and Windows settings.
segment.target: The UE-V agent installs a default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications and Windows settings.

segment.source: If your enterprise needs customized versions of these templates, the UE-V agent can be configured to use a settings template catalog and you should then replace the default Microsoft templates.
segment.target: If your enterprise needs customized versions of these templates, the UE-V agent can be configured to use a settings template catalog and you should then replace the default Microsoft templates.

segment.source: During the installation of the UE-V agent, the command-line parameter, , can be used to disable the registration of the default Microsoft templates.
segment.target: During the installation of the UE-V agent, the command-line parameter, , can be used to disable the registration of the default Microsoft templates.

segment.source: For more information about how to set the UE-V parameters, see Planning for UE-V Configuration Methods.
segment.target: For more information about how to set the UE-V parameters, see Planning for UE-V Configuration Methods.

segment.source: When you use Group Policy to configure the settings template catalog path, you can choose to replace the default Microsoft templates.
segment.target: When you use Group Policy to configure the settings template catalog path, you can choose to replace the default Microsoft templates.

segment.source: If you configure the policy settings to replace the default Microsoft templates, all of the default Microsoft templates that are installed by the UE-V agent will be deleted from the computer, and only the templates that are located in the settings template catalog will be used.
segment.target: If you configure the policy settings to replace the default Microsoft templates, all of the default Microsoft templates that are installed by the UE-V agent will be deleted from the computer, and only the templates that are located in the settings template catalog will be used.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent configuration setting must be set to true in order to override the default Microsoft template.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent configuration setting must be set to true in order to override the default Microsoft template.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting after it has been enabled, the UE-V agent will not restore the default Microsoft templates.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting after it has been enabled, the UE-V agent will not restore the default Microsoft templates.

segment.source: If there are customized templates in the settings template catalog that use the same ID as the default Microsoft templates, and the UE-V agent is not configured to replace the default Microsoft templates, the Microsoft templates in the catalog will be ignored.
segment.target: If there are customized templates in the settings template catalog that use the same ID as the default Microsoft templates, and the UE-V agent is not configured to replace the default Microsoft templates, the Microsoft templates in the catalog will be ignored.

segment.source: You can also replace the default templates by using the UE-V PowerShell features.
segment.target: You can also replace the default templates by using the UE-V PowerShell features.

segment.source: To replace the default Microsoft Template with PowerShell, unregister all of the default Microsoft templates, and then register the customized templates.
segment.target: To replace the default Microsoft Template with PowerShell, unregister all of the default Microsoft templates, and then register the customized templates.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Old settings packages remain in the settings storage location even if new settings templates are deployed for an application.
segment.target: Old settings packages remain in the settings storage location even if new settings templates are deployed for an application.

segment.source: These packages are not read by the agent, but neither are they automatically deleted.
segment.target: These packages are not read by the agent, but neither are they automatically deleted.
